name: Crispy Salt and Pepper Beef (Thịt Bò Chiên Muối Tiêu)
description: A quick and seriously tasty beef recipe that’s commonly served in Chinese restaurants. Tender beef slices marinated with salt, pepper, and Chinese five-spice powder; coated in an egg white batter then deep-fried. The crispy beef is tossed with a bit of salt and pepper as a finishing touch and voila, dinner is on the table in less than 20 minutes.
keywords: crispy salt and pepper beef, salt and pepper beef, crispy salt and pepper beef recipe, salt and pepper beef recipe, how to make crispy salt and pepper beef, salt and pepper crispy beef, thit bo chien muoi tieu, thit bo chien, Chinese salt and pepper beef, how to make Chinese salt and pepper beef, beef recipe, Asian beef recipe, Asian beef, the best crispy salt and pepper beef, salt and pepper beef Chinese, salt and pepper beef Vietnamese

video.name: Crispy Salt & Pepper Beef (Thịt Bò Chiên Muối Tiêu)
video.description: Crispy Salt & Pepper Beef (Thịt Bò Chiên Muối Tiêu)

recipeIngredient: 1 lb beef sirloin (slice into thin strips against the grain)
recipeInstructions: In a large bowl, marinate beef strips with salt (½ teaspoon), ground black pepper (¼ teaspoon), Chinese five-spice powder, and baking soda for at least 10 minutes.
In a separate bowl, beat egg whites and cornstarch until there are no longer clumps. Add egg white mixture to the marinated beef. Gently toss until evenly coated.
Deep-fry the battered beef strips in batches for 2 minutes each batch or until golden brown. Transfer to a wire rack or plate lined with paper towels to remove excess oil.
Add cooked beef to a large mixing bowl and toss evenly with remaining salt and pepper. Serve immediately for best results.
